WordsClass.Definition: used before countable or singular nouns referring to people or things that have not already been mentioned
to leave somebody, especially somebody you are responsible for, with no intention of returning
able to do something (used as a modal verb) to have the skill, intelligence, opportunity, etc. needed to do something
a little more or less than; a little before or after
at or to a higher place or position than something/somebody
to respect somebody for what they have done or to respect their qualities
a room in which there is a bath/ bathtub, a washbasin and often a toilet
a device that is placed inside a car engine, clock, radio, etc. and that produces the electricity that makes it work
hair that grows on the chin and cheeks of a man’s face; similar hair that grows on some animals
the first meal of the day
thick strong metal rope used on ships, for supporting bridges, etc.
to use numbers to find out a total number, amount, distance, etc.
cancel something to decide that something that has been arranged will not now take place
charge (for something) the amount of money that somebody asks for goods and services
costing little money or less money than you expected
fairly cold; not hot or warm
a particular day of the month, sometimes in a particular year, given in numbers and words
defeat somebody/something to win against somebody in a war, competition, sports game, etc.
a small individual fact or item; a less important fact or item
an object or a piece of equipment that has been designed to do a particular job
devoted (to somebody/something) having great love for somebody/something and being loyal to them
a book that gives a list of the words of a language in alphabetical order and explains what they mean, or gives a word for them in a foreign language
different (from/to/than somebody/something) not the same as somebody/something; not like somebody/something else
he world; the planet that we live on
to put food in your mouth, chew it and swallow it
the relationship between production, trade and the supply of money in a particular country or region
a small oval object with a thin hard shell produced by a female bird and containing a young bird; a similar object produced by a female fish, insect, etc.
a machine that carries people or goods up and down to different levels in a building or a mine
to experience something, especially something unpleasant or difficult, while you are trying to do something else
engage something (formal) to succeed in attracting and keeping somebody’s attention and interest
a person whose job involves designing and building engines, machines, roads, bridges, etc.
to get pleasure from something
a flat paper container used for sending letters in
a judgement that you make without having the exact details or figures about the size, amount, cost, etc. of something
used after a list to show that there are other things that you could have mentioned (the abbreviation for ‘et cetera’)
the part of the day between the afternoon and the time you go to bed
a person or thing that is not included in a general statement
feeling or showing pleasure; pleased
solid, firm or stiff and difficult to bend or break
to put or keep somebody/something in a place where they/it cannot be seen or found
an area of land that is higher than the land around it, but not as high as a mountain
an illness that is caused by bacteria or a virus and that affects one part of the body
facts or details about somebody/something
wanting to do something or wanting something to happen very much
to hit a door, etc. firmly in order to attract attention, to hit something, often by accident, with a short, hard blow
a piece of paper, etc. that is attached to something and that gives information about it
lack (of something) the state of not having something or not having enough of something
limit (to something) a point at which something stops being possible or existing
having good luck
obey (somebody/something) to do what you are told or expected to do
a thing that can be seen and touched, but is not alive
a tube through which liquids and gases can flow
[countable] a large round object in space that moves around a star (such as the sun) and receives light from it

[uncountable, countable, usually plural] a light strong material that is produced by chemical processes and can be formed into shapes when heated. There are many different types of plastic, used to make different objects and fabrics.
(often the police) [plural] an official organization whose job is to make people obey the law and to prevent and solve crime; the people who work for this organization
[uncountable, singular] preference (for somebody/something) a greater interest in or desire for somebody/something than somebody/something else
preserve something to keep a particular quality, feature, etc.; to make sure that something is kept
one of four equal parts of something
following a pattern, especially with the same time or space in between each thing and the next
to rest while you are doing something enjoyable, especially after work or effort
unhappy or showing unhappiness
[uncountable, countable] a mixture of raw vegetables such as lettuce, tomato and cucumber, usually served with other food as part of a meal
a thick liquid that is eaten with food to add flavour to it
to frighten somebody
a tool for cutting paper or cloth, that has two sharp blades with handles, joined together in the middle
the flat surface at the front of a television, computer, or other electronic device, on which you see pictures or information

one of the two groups of elected politicians who make laws in some countries, for example in the US, Australia, Canada and France. The Senate is smaller than the other group but higher in rank. Many state parliaments in the US also have a Senate.
a member of a senate
connected with society and the way it is organized
a small round solid piece of medicine that you swallow
an examination of somebody’s knowledge or ability, consisting of questions for them to answer or activities for them to perform
happening at the end of a long process
not letting you feel physically comfortable; unpleasant to wear, sit on, etc.
joined together as a political unit or by shared aims
unlucky (to do something) having bad luck or happening because of bad luck; not lucky
without wanting to do or be something, but forced to by other people
willing (to do something) not objecting to doing something; having no reason for not doing something
[countable] a single unit of language which means something and can be spoken or written
